Package main.Teams

Class Team

java.lang.Object
main.Teams.Team
Direct Known Subclasses:
OpposingTeam, PlayerTeam
public abstract class Team extends Object
The abstract superclass for PlayerTeam and OpposingTeam. The superclass handles methods for storing the team's name and active Athletes. Player-specific functions including reserve members and Item inventory are handled by the PlayerTeam subclass.

      public Team()
      Constructor.

  • Method Details

    • getName

      public String getName()
      Gets team name.
      Returns:
      String containing team name.

    • setName

      public void setName(String newName)
      Sets team name.
      Parameters:
      newName - Desired new name.

    • setRandomGen

      public void setRandomGen(int seed)
      Allows the player to set a desired seed for random number generation in certain elements of the game.
      Parameters:
      newSeed - Int representing desired random seed.

    • setRandomGen

      public void setRandomGen()
      Starts a random number generator for generation of random events, Items, etc. during team generation. May be overriden by a specific seed given by the player if desired.

    • getRandomGen

      public Random getRandomGen()
      Gets the number generator object.
      Returns:
      Random number generator.

    • getSize

      public int getSize()
      Gets length of main team array. Always set to 5 by default.
      Returns:
      Int representing size of main Athlete[] array. Should always be 5.

    • getTeamMember

      public Athlete getTeamMember(int slot)
      Gets a specific Athlete from the given slot.
      Parameters:
      slot - The array index to retrieve an Athlete from.
      Returns:
      The Athlete found in the main team at the specified slot.

    • removeMember

      public void removeMember(Athlete member)
      Generates a dummy and replaces the given Athlete in the team array with them. Use with caution!
      Parameters:
      member - The Athlete to be replaced.

    • getAllTeam

      public Athlete[] getAllTeam()
      Gets the entire team array.
      Returns:
      Athlete[] array containing the entire active team.

    • addToTeam

      public void addToTeam(Athlete newMember, int slot, boolean firstSetup)
      Adds an Athlete to the active team. Outside of initial setup, slots already containing a non-dummy Athlete cannot be overwritten.
      Parameters:
      newMember - The new Athlete to be added.
      slot - The slot to add the given Athlete at.
      firstSetup - 'True' if being called during initial game setup.

    • overwriteSlot

      public void overwriteSlot(Athlete[] array, int slot, Athlete athlete)
      Completely overwrites the given slot with the given Athlete. Use with extreme caution, as the previous occupant will be discarded.
      Parameters:
      array - The array for the Athlete to be added to.
      slot - The index for the Athlete to be added to in the given array.
      athlete - The Athlete to be added.

    • genTeamStrength

      public int genTeamStrength(Athlete athlete, int currentStrength, int currentStat)
      Calculates overall team strength by summing Athlete stats.
      Parameters:
      athlete - The Athlete to get stat numbers from.
      currentStrength - The value to be added to.
      currentStat - The stat to be calulated.

    • getTeamStrength

      public int[] getTeamStrength()
      Calculates overall team stats across the entire Athlete array with support from genTeamStrength(...).
      Returns:
      Integer array of results.

    • printTeam

      public String printTeam()
      Gets names of all members of the Athlete array along with their position numbers and specialization.
      Returns:
      String containing names, specializations, and slot numbers of all Athletes.

    • printTeamStats

      public String printTeamStats()
      Formats the overall team stats as generated by getTeamStrength().
      Returns:
      String containing team stats formatted for readability.
